definition: "cliff" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 27), occurring in 原, 历, 压 etc
to go to the kitchen (to prepare a meal)/to cook
lit. a nobleman stays clear of the kitchen (idiom, from Mencius)/fig. a nobleman who has seen a living animal cannot bear to see it die, hence he keeps away from the kitchen

sentences.english: Betty Crocker called for half a cup of chopped walnuts.
sentences.chinese: 《贝蒂妙厨》上要求半杯打碎的核桃仁。

sentences.english: That means each person on average wastes about half-a-kilogram a day.
sentences.chinese: 换言之，每人每天平均制造半公斤厨馀。

sentences.english: Pharaoh was angry with his two officers, the chief of butlers , and the chief of bakers.
sentences.chinese: 法郎于是对那两个内臣，司酒长和司厨长发了怒。

sentences.english: One cannot be selected as the head of the jury if one has not first been an approved WACS judge.
sentences.chinese: 没当过世厨协会裁判的人是不能当陪审团的总代表的。

sentences.english: Especially from my Sr. Sous Chef Kevin and my Jr. Sous Chef Bruce.
sentences.chinese: 尤其是从我的老副厨凯文和我的小副厨布鲁斯。

sentences.english: Especially from my Sr. Sous Chef Kevin and my Jr. Sous Chef Bruce.
sentences.chinese: 尤其是从我的老副厨凯文和我的小副厨布鲁斯。

sentences.english: Without stopping to think, he darted out of the cupboard, grabbed the hen and scrambled down the beanstalk.
sentences.chinese: 来不及多想，他冲出碗厨，抓起母鸡，爬下了豆茎。

sentences.english: This study include the feasibility of food waste thermophilic hydrogen fermentation.
sentences.chinese: 在本研究中也进行厨馀高温发酵之可行性探讨。

sentences.english: They have desks , sofas , bookcases and cabinets on sale .
sentences.chinese: 他们有书桌，沙发，书架和厨俱廉售。

definition: to go to the kitchen (to prepare a meal)/to cook
to be in charge of the cooking/to be the chef/head cook/chef
to arrange/to handle/to cook/cuisine/art of cooking
dish (type of food)/vegetable/cuisine/CL:盤|盘[pan2],道[dao4]/(coll.) (one's) type/(of one's skills etc) weak/poor
